reviews.sentence: Would stay again. Service was great both for hotel and lobby bar staff. Convenient location. Older hotel but rooms seemed remodeled. One exception was plumbing fixtures seemed old.

Great downtown hotel. Excellent rooms restaurant and bar. Centrally located. Good all around hotel. Stayed there for a week on business. The hotel is an older building but the rooms are newly renovated. The place has the solid stately feel of an old property with modern conveniences.

Could be better. Fair dowtown hotel. Not too good nor too bad. Mattress to worn out and down in the center. Not good for your back. The AC did not work and had to request repair couple times the next day. The room was in all clean and comfortable. But it will not stay in my memory as any special place I have been to. Sorry.

Hilton Checkers Los Angeles July 4 2016. The Hotel is a great Boutique hotel in downtown Los Angeles and very centrally located. But the service was not that good and lobby can be spruced up a bit. Was a bit of a disappointment for a Hilton Hotel. But I still enjoy saying at most Hilton Hotels and it has great HONOR member benefits.
Great price for DTLA. The Bed was really comfortable. The restrooms need to be updated.
The room was dusty smelled as it had not been refreshed. I itched all night.

Great for Downtown. Stayed at the Hilton checkers for the first time. Building is being remodeled but was of no inconvenience. Hotel is quiet and located well to walk to the Contemporary Art Museum and The Broad Museum and several local attractions. There were several restaurants to pick from in walking distance. The staff was very nice and the door men especially. There was a bar on the roof for the weekend but one in the lobby Did not eat in the hotel which had a place.
Clean rooms with comfy beds. Rooms feel a bit in need of some updates TLC. Slow internet. Staff is a mixture of helpful and begrudging.
When the renovations are finished it will be lovely. We were n’t bothered by the renovations at all though no noise and little mess.

I LOVED this Hotel. I will be honest I read the reviews HERE and called the hotel before I booked as people mentioned it was under renovation. Well not all floors are being renovated it is fine and gorgeous and NOT noisy at all. The lobby restaurant entrance mezzanine and most upper floors are already remodeled and GORGEOUS. Every single employee was enjoyable and helpful and I am being 100 honest. I travel a lot to be a Diamond and this was top notch. I will be back very soon.

Hilton Checkers is a good play. I have stayed at several hotels in downtown Los Angeles and always prefer the Checkers. Seems to have been updated and the staff is very friendly. I like the location next to the library as it provides some green in a downtown landscape.

Best Hotel in Downtown Los Angeles. The Hilton Checkers is an excellent choice if you are looking for a downtown hotel as it is centrally located to all tourist sites and businesses. My room on the 12th floor had an outstanding view of the downtown buildings which was especially impressive at night. Although the building is historic all of the amenities inside have been updated and are modern. I was very pleased with the level of customer service provided to me by Joana. She was kind knowledgeable and very helpful to me during my stay there. I would highly recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

Diamond no longer has its priveledges. Recently refreshed rooms and lobby look nice. Staff is terrific and friendly. Limited room types so upgrades hard to notice. Diamond breakfast benefit is for cold continental only or 15 credit that barely pays for coffee and toast if you go ala carte. With remodel they discontinued free drink benefit. Gym small with old equipment. Decent hotel but they do not seem to value their most frequent travelers.

Great spot downtown. This was a neat hotel with way more character than a typical Hilton almost like a boutique style Hilton. The room had clearly just been renovated and was tastefully decorated. The TV in the room was massive. I loved the rooftop patio though I wish they served food and drinks up there. One small critique is that they seemed to have only one working elevator and it was slow.
Newly renovated charming building and centrally located. Helpful staff.
Renovation is nice and staff very friendly. Location is great for downtown meetings. Would stay there again.

Refurb is good what about the staff. The hotel has had a good refurb since I was last there in 2014. The rooms are better but the service and staff attitude are worse than ever. Check in was 27 mins. My bags got to the room an hour after check in. Room service was so slow I was not really hungary after 93 mins. Then the best part was when I addressed my issues and the manager offered Hilton points. I was only there for 2 nights but this was not good on any level. It also took 16 mins for checkout. Needs to improve.

Luxurious. Rooms were newly renovated luxurious and clean. They were also spacious and came with Crabtre and Evelyn ProductsTea coffee and ironing facilities in room. The King room had a humongous TV with a couchThe only negative is that the beds need revamping as they were bowing in the center. I found this strange considering that the hotel was recently renovated. The hotel is close to a bus stop and the subway. The subways are clean and efficient use the subway to avoid the terrible traficThe hotel is well situated in Downtown LA close to shopping Macys Nordstrom Rack HM Zara etc close to LA Live and Staples Center near the Broad and the Disney Concert Hall. There is a Whole Foods nearby and a lovely Mexican Joint Chipotle Grill with wholesome meals.

Massive Let Down and Horrible Experience. Just stayed here this week for business and while they had some nice renovations to an old building in a great walking area it ’s a complete disaster. As a new Hilton Diamond member coming from Mariot Ambassador and I can clearly see the lack of proper training by this Hilton property. No acknowledgement of status except for getting 2 bottles of water in a paper brown bag. Door men are asleep at the wheel with helping with bags and valet service. Walls are paper thin so I was woken by next door neighbors bring home love from the club at 3 am. Called the front desk and security did nothing the first time. At 330 I called again when they finally knocked on the door which did n’t help. Having people raging at 3 4am is not great but worse is a property who drags their feet on fixing the problem. Even the neighbor across the hall said something about it the next morning. Check out was apathetic no help no questions about my stay especially with Hilton ’s “ make it right guarantee ”. Sadly another false marketing ploy to get you to spend money at a subpar serviced hotel. This is no more than a 15 star property with lipstick on the greatest day ever. Such a historic place and the developer wasted a ton of capital when its run no better than a cheap motel down the road. Mariot is n’t perfect but come on guys at least be competitive. Do n’t waste a stay here and there are plenty of other options in DTLA. NOT recommended and negative 10 ⭐ ️ for the property and Hilton unfortunately.

Best in Downtown LA. I have been going to Checkers for over 15 years. I travel a lot for work and this is the only hotel in downtown LA that I will stay at. The staff know me and treat me like a VIP every time. The rooms have been recently renovated and are very comfortable and elegant. The service is attentive and the staff are always looking to improve your stay.

Very nice hotel. Super friendly hotel staff. Sparkling clean rooms tastefully refurbished keeping the old 1927 highlights. Great location. Save a little and park at Pershing Sqaure. Walk through the Biltmore lobby street to street makes it convenient. Skip the breakfast its not very good and at 60 for 2 run.
Updated lobby and guestrooms make this place look historic on the outside but modern from within.

Hoped for more. Let me begin by saying that the service was mostly excellent and friendly. From the valet to the guest services rep when you called for something though every other call went unanswered the first timeI came for a wedding about ten years ago and had fond memories of the hotel. But things today are quite different. It has the Hilton makeover which adds a little life to this but the structure is the same old small noisy. There are very few amenities and all come at a premium. I chose this stay for two reasons the manager secured my business by re extending a rate that had just expired and I wanted to try out my new diamond status that I had to charge 400 last year to get. Kudos to the manager diamond status on the other hand is quickly headed to non renewal. Upon check in I was greeted by a very cute and friendly redhead who told me they were behind on housekeeping and the only room they had available was on the first floor. I asked her if with my diamond status if it was possible I could get a room with a seating area as I had a business meeting with another individual. She said she could put me in a different room handed me my keys and I rode up to the 12th floor one below the penthouse. Unfortunately a high floor room was all my diamond status got me which is what gold status would ’ve gotten me. The room was clean and nice but tiny. It had a small loveseat at the base of the bed about 3 feet from TV and facing the TV. Literally impossible for 2 people to face each other even if one is on bed and talk. The door rattled which I fixed by wedging in one of the 50 unnecessary placards and cards they have in the room and the shower pipes rattled and the water sputtered but it went away after a few minutes. The body wash shampoo and conditioner are in large dispensers affixed today the shower wall which is something usually used by gyms and Airbnb ’s. But the bathroom was spacious towels soft clearly the best part of the room. Hit the fitness room briefly which was small but had a good selection of free weights and treadmills. There were no towels and I did n’t bother calling as I knew housekeeping was stretched thin. I took my meeting in the lobby and again the staff was exceptionally friendly. They wear jeans as part of their uniform and it adds an unnecessarily casual element to the environment. The lobby bar area is small and not very lively even on a Saturday night. When the meeting concluded I checked the website again and saw larger rooms not even suites were still available leaving me to wonder further what good is diamond status. The location is good and I was able to walk to an event at the Jonathan Club four blocks away. Other than the rattling door and pipes there was no noise to interfere with sleep. TV had no premium movies or pay per view movies. Did n’t bother with WiFi. Overall the staff does their best to be friendly and attentive but they are n’t always there when you call. Valet at checkout time was overwhelmed and it took about 15 min from when I called to get my car. The rates are not very competitive and parking is 49. I wo n’t stay here again especially when third party aps had rooms at the Biltmore across the street for less than what I paid with a special rate. That ’s a lot more hotel for your money.
